Package jetbrains.exodus.entitystore

Interface EntityIterable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Entity>
    public interface EntityIterable
extends java.lang.Iterable<Entity>
    EntityIterable allows to lazily iterate over entities. It's a result of all StoreTransaction methods that query, sort and filter entities.

    EntityIterable is valid only against particular database snapshot, so finishing transaction (commit() or abort) or moving it to the newest snapshot (flush() or revert()) breaks iteration.

    See Also:
    StoreTransaction, EntityIterator, Entity

      • size

        long size()
        Returns the number of entities in the EntityIterable. This method can be slow.
        Returns:
        the number of entities in the EntityIterable
        See Also:
        isEmpty(), count(), getRoughCount(), getRoughSize()

      • count

        long count()
        Returns the number of entities in the EntityIterable, or -1 if it cannot be calculated immediately. If it returns -1, it starts background calculation of size(), so deferred call to this method should eventually return a value different from -1 and equal to size().
        Returns:
        the number of entities in the EntityIterable, or -1 if it cannot be calculated immediately
        See Also:
        isEmpty(), size(), getRoughCount(), getRoughSize()

      • getRoughCount

        long getRoughCount()
        Returns rough number of entities in the EntityIterable, or -1 if the size of the EntityIterable was never calculated. In other words, it returns the same value as size() if it can be calculated immediately, or last known size, or -1 in the worst case. This method is eventually consistent, i.e. its result (different form -1) can differ from result of size() and count().
        Returns:
        rough number of entities in the EntityIterable
        See Also:
        isEmpty(), size(), count(), getRoughSize()

      • getRoughSize

        long getRoughSize()
        Returns the same value as getRoughCount(), but in the worst case it returns size() instead of -1. So it never returns -1, but it is still eventually consistent as its result can differ from the result of size().
        Returns:
        rough number of entities in the EntityIterable
        See Also:
        isEmpty(), size(), count(), getRoughCount()

      • indexOf

        int indexOf​(@NotNull
            @NotNull Entity entity)
        Returns index of specified entity in the EntityIterable, or -1 if there is no such entity. The index can be defined as follows: if int i = indexOf(entity) and i is not equal to -1 then the value of skip(i).getFirst() should be not-null and equal to entity.
        Parameters:
        entity - entity to search for
        Returns:
        index of an entity in the EntityIterable, or -1 if there is no such entity
        See Also:
        contains(Entity)

      • contains

        boolean contains​(@NotNull
                 @NotNull Entity entity)
        Returns true if the EntityIterable contains specified entity. In short, it just returns value of indexOf(entity) != -1.
        Parameters:
        entity - entity whose presence in the EntityIterable is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the EntityIterable contains specified entity
        See Also:
        indexOf(Entity)

@NotNull EntityIterable intersectSavingOrder​(@NotNull

        Parameters:

      • minus

        @NotNull
@NotNull EntityIterable minus​(@NotNull
                              @NotNull EntityIterable right)
        Returns relative complement of the right EntityIterable in this EntityIterable, i.e. set-theoretic difference of this EntityIterable and the right EntityIterable.
        Parameters:
        right - EntityIterable which entities will excluded (subtracted) from this EntityIterable
        Returns:
        relative complement of the right EntityIterable in this EntityIterable
        See Also:
        intersect(EntityIterable), union(EntityIterable), concat(EntityIterable)

      • concat

        @NotNull
@NotNull EntityIterable concat​(@NotNull
                               @NotNull EntityIterable right)
        Returns concatenation of this EntityIterable and the right EntityIterable. Unlike other binary operations, result can have duplicate entities.
        Parameters:
        right - EntityIterable that should be concatenated to this EntityIterable
        Returns:
        concatenated EntityIterable
        See Also:
        intersect(EntityIterable), union(EntityIterable), minus(EntityIterable)

      • distinct

      • selectDistinct

        @NotNull
@NotNull EntityIterable selectDistinct​(@NotNull
                                       @NotNull java.lang.String linkName)
        Returns entities which the source entities (this EntityIterable) are linked with by the link with specified name. In order words, if target = source.getLink(linkName) for each source from this EntityIterable, then target is a part of the result. It is implied that the link should be single, i.e. targets should be set using method Entity.setLink(String, Entity), so only one target for each source can be. Order of linked entities is undefined.
        Parameters:
        linkName - name of the link
        Returns:
        entities linked by the link
        See Also:
        Entity.getLink(String), Entity.setLink(String, Entity)

      • selectManyDistinct

        @NotNull
@NotNull EntityIterable selectManyDistinct​(@NotNull
                                           @NotNull java.lang.String linkName)
        Returns entities which the source entities (this EntityIterable) are linked with by the link with specified name. In order words, if targets = source.getLinks(linkName) for each source from this EntityIterable, then each target amongst targets is a part of the result. It is implied that the link can me multiple, i.e. targets can be set using any method updating links, Entity.setLink(String, Entity)or Entity.addLink(String, Entity), so there can be arbitrary number of targets for each source. Order of linked entities is undefined.
        Parameters:
        linkName - name of the link
        Returns:
        entities linked by the link
        See Also:
        Entity.getLink(String), Entity.addLink(String, Entity)

      • getFirst

        @Nullable
@Nullable Entity getFirst()
        Returns:
        the first entity of the EntityIterable, or null is it is empty

      • getLast

        @Nullable
@Nullable Entity getLast()
        Returns:
        the last entity of the EntityIterable, or null is it is empty

      • reverse

        @NotNull
@NotNull EntityIterable reverse()
        Returns:
        the same entities as the EntityIterable returns, but in reverse order

      • isSortResult

        boolean isSortResult()
        Custom sorting algorithms can mark their results as sort results. Built-in sort engine recognizes intermediate results as sort results in order to make sorting stable when sorting by several fields, or even using custom sorting algorithms.
        Returns:
        true if this EntityIterable is a result of sorting
        See Also:
        asSortResult(), StoreTransaction.sort(String, String, EntityIterable, boolean), StoreTransaction.sortLinks(String, EntityIterable, boolean, String, EntityIterable), StoreTransaction.mergeSorted(List, Comparator)

      • asSortResult

        @NotNull
@NotNull EntityIterable asSortResult()
        Marks this EntityIterable as sort result, so built-in sort engine can recognize custom sorting for stable sorting. E.g., in the following sample custom sorting will be lost: 
             final EntityIterable customSorting = myCustomSorting();
     return txn.sort("User", "loginTime", customSorting, true);
        To fix it, just mark custom sorting result as sort result: 
             final EntityIterable customSorting = myCustomSorting();
     return txn.sort("User", "loginTime", customSorting.asSortResult(), true);
        Returns:
        EntityIterable marked as sort result
        See Also:
        isSortResult(), StoreTransaction.sort(String, String, EntityIterable, boolean), StoreTransaction.sortLinks(String, EntityIterable, boolean, String, EntityIterable), StoreTransaction.mergeSorted(List, Comparator)
